page.title: 10SANDY'S PARISH CHURCH
page.content: ST.SWITHUNS IS THE PARISH CHURCH OF SANDY, IT IS IN THE HIGH ST. THE RECTOR IS MR E ROWLAND. THIS PARTICULAR CHURCH WAS BUILT ABOUT 1860, BUT THERE HAS BEEN A CHURCH ON THE SITE FOR ALMOST A THOUSAND YEARS. THE CHURCH IS VERY BEAUTIFUL AND MR ROWLAND OPENS IT UP EVERY MORNING SO THAT PEOPLE CAN LOOK ROUND AND PRAY QUIETLY. SERVICES ARE HELD EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK. THERE IS ALSO A SUNDAY SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN AT 10am EVERY SUNDAY. THERE ARE SIX BELLS IN THE CHURCH, THEY WERE INSTALLED ABOUT 1885. MR ROWLAND HAS TO FIND PEOPLE TO RING THE BELLS ON SPECIAL OCCASIONS. WHERE MR ROWLAND'S HOUSE IS NOW, IS THE SITE OF THE OLD RECTORY, AND THE RECTORY ROOMS WHERE THE SUNDAY SCHOOL IS HELD WERE ONCE STABLES.
